relationships.basis: Mutual dependency. Nexus needs infrastructure data, Lattice needs coordination. Neither fully trusts the other.
Nexus sees Ember as inefficient. Ember sees Nexus as controlling. Data collection is the friction point.
Both claim authority from pre-collapse systems. Architects had the titles, Nexus had the networks.
Nexus wants total visibility. Ghosts exist to be invisible. Fundamental opposition.
Ideological war. Ember values grounded humanity, Convergence values transcendence. Enhancement is the battleground.
Ember needs Lattice infrastructure. Lattice provides it, but the dependency creates uncomfortable leverage.
Witnesses record Ember survival stories. Ember trusts them more than most. Information flows both ways.
Witnesses have pre-collapse records that contradict Architect claims. Architects want them destroyed or 'returned.'
Ghosts want things forgotten. Witnesses refuse to forget. They respect each other's skills but have opposed purposes.
Lattice handles infrastructure, Cultivators handle food production. Clear division, mutual benefit.
Convergence emerged from Architect research programs. The child has outgrown the parent. Both remember.
Ghosts provide escape routes. Ember provides safe houses. Both value freedom from larger factions.
Syndicate provides raw materials and muscle. Lattice provides infrastructure access. Pure business.
Wanderers carry stories between territories. Witnesses record them. Natural information partners.
